description: Via Urdu دربار‎ / Hindi दरबार (darbār) from Persian دربار‎ (darbâr, “royal court”).

entries.meaning: (historical) A ceremonial gathering held by a ruler in India.
examples: He decided to stage a durbar on the plains outside the city, at which the Afghans would be able to express their loyalty to their new ruler.

entries.meaning: (historical) The body of officials at a royal or princely court in India.
